review: Fish Oil (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):Have taken for 25 years due to bad reactions to statins.  Reduced my triglycerides from 1200 to 230.

Lovaza (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):I started taking this 9/19. By Oct I thought I had pancreatitis. Stomach acid high, no ulcer. Horrible stomach pain continued till they put me on ulcer meds, but no ulcer. Bad back pain like my back was breaking by May. MRI no new issues and PT not helping. Looked at side effects after getting hives and a rash. I think my body has had enough of this. Now, I have a liver cyst. Read side effects before taking.

Lovaza (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):Always had a higher than normal triglycerides but my blood work they were 475. I already take 20 mg of Lipitor so Dr. added  Lovaza. After 1 month my new number is 143. I did start walking  30 minutes 5 x per week and cut back on white carbs/sugar but that is a big difference! No side effects - except a slight fishy taste the first week which went away after that. GREAT MED!

Lovaza (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):This drug is a total rip off.  I took it for a few years. No measurable improvement in triglycerides levels.  Changed insurance company and new thieves wouldn't cover.  Found a fish oil spill at Costco. the highest octane pill they sell.  Nature bounty.  Have had the best blood tests in years ever since.

Lovaza (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):Went to cardiologist on 2/2019 and my Triglycerides where 530,  waaay high.  Since then I have changed my diet significantly (lower carb and calorie counting).  Lost 16 pounds so far, and exercise 5x/week.  Has my trigs tested again this week and went down to 179.  Taking 4 grams/day of Lovaza.  Only side effect I had was burpy fish taste sometimes.  I don't know which aspect of my changes (the meds, diet, exercise) had the most impact on getting my trigs down, but  am happy with where they are going.    My terrible insurance company would not even pay for it, so I am using the generic version - $50/month.
Lovaza (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):I have tried Lovaza twice over the years and it always gave me such an upset stomach I had to stop taking it.
Lovaza (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):Triglyceride levels reduced markedly. Very surprised!
Lovaza (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):Worked very well.  Triglicerides went from 2,000 to 600 in just 3 weeks.  The only medication that worked for me.
Lovaza (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):Did not significantly help with my triglycerides. Caused severe chest pain and shortness of breath.
Omacor (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):I use this medicine since several years now, and my triglyceride level has dropped 20-30. Also my cholesterol is OK now. I use 4 grams a day.

EPA Fish Oil (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):This worked for me! I take 40 mg of Zocor and the fish oil-Omega 3 fatty acids and together they brought my triglycerides below normal levels as well as total cholesterol numbers!

Lovaza (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):I've used Lovaza for about 8 months and triglycerides are now 900, before it was 3000. My family, sister and father have very high triglycerides. This is the only drug that has ever worked for me and I've used them all. I got my sister to tell her Doctor about it and he put her on Omacor, hers went from 1000 to 250 in 3 months. I just wonder how common this illness is.

Omacor (omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids):I have had hypothyroidisim since I was 10 years old. I am not over weight, I do not eat red meat but my cholesterol is close to 300. I have used 5 different statins, they work but I am left with cramping in my thighs or my gut and therefore I can't take them.Omacor lowerd my cholesterol to 212 without pain of any kind. It is a more natural approach to cholesterol. managment.
